title: SAKURA: On the Multi-hop Reasoning of Large Audio-Language Models Based on Speech and Audio Information
author: Chih-Kai Yang (National Taiwan University), Neo Ho (National Taiwan University), Yen-Ting Piao (National Taiwan University), Hung-yi Lee (National Taiwan University), ...
relevance_why: This paper introduces a benchmark for evaluating multi-hop reasoning abilities in large audio-language models, which is relevant as it can inform future developments in audio integration techniques and multimodal systems relevant to Haohe's focus on audio-language models.
background: Evaluating multi-hop reasoning abilities of large audio-language models that process speech and audio inputs, to determine their capacity for integrating information across multiple representations.
contribution: This paper introduces the SAKURA benchmark to evaluate large audio-language models' multi-hop reasoning, achieving insights into the models' limitations in integrating audio representations within reasoning tasks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing benchmarks focus primarily on speech and audio processing without comprehensive evaluation of reasoning abilities.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work systematically addresses the gap in evaluating multi-hop reasoning specific to audio and speech contexts, offering a structured approach.

key_innovation: The SAKURA benchmark uniquely combines single-hop and multi-hop tasks across various audio attributes, allowing for a nuanced understanding of reasoning processes.
real_world_impact: This research could enhance the design and evaluation of audio-language models, leading to more effective systems in fields such as speech recognition, emotion detection, and human-computer interaction.
limitations: The study currently only investigates four speech/audio attributes and does not address acoustic variability which may affect performance.

new_terms.multi-hop reasoning: **Multi-hop reasoning** refers to the capability of models to integrate information from multiple independent facts or sources to answer complex queries.
new_terms.large audio-language models (LALMs): **Large audio-language models (LALMs)** represent a class of models that integrate audio signals and language understanding for various computational tasks.

open_sourcing: The resources related to the dataset and evaluation methods are available at https://github.com/b08202033/SAKURA.
